Dialogue: C'mon, Sid, don't fade on us. We've been planning this baby for a year. Humor us.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Nope. You had your chance.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Shit.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: We met on the internet.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: He sent me the cutest e-mail.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: I read her postings on the horror movie chat boards and fell hopelessly. Hook, line...

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: We have our own website now. We dedicated a whole page to you.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: You'd me amazed at how many of us there are out there. It's a whole world, Sid. You're really popular amongst the demented.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: You're the one who got away.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Until now.

Speaker: cotton
Dialogue: You guys are fucked.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Actually Cotton, and I think critics would agree, it's the other way around.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Poor Cotton, could life be a little more cruel?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You're not going to get away with this.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Of course not. Who wants to? What's the point if we don't get caught? Where's the glamour in that?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: The way I see it. We'll be arrested. Go to prison. Cash in on the home footage. Secure a book deal. If all goes as planned, our trial should coincide with the release of STAB II.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: A verdict and premiere all on the same day. I love it.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: We're hoping for the death penalty. I have this whole DEAD MAN WALKING swan song exit planned.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: And now, drum roll please...

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Hope you're ready, Sid. We got one last surprise for you.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: A twist ending if you will.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Yeah, we really had our work cut out for us. It really is the curse of the sequel. The Billy/Stu thing's been done.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: ... so we had to be different but yet the same because if you venture to far away from your orginal story you completely alienate the audience...

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: And we didn't want to do that, Sid. We wanted to give you your money's worth.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: So we found a compromise.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Or it found us.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: We have a surprise guest star waiting in the wings.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Just for you, Sid.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Wait a sec, Derek. We forgot to flip.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Oh yeah.  Heads or tails?

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Tails.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Shit! You win.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Sidney!

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Gale!

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: It's about time she showed up.

Speaker: debbie salt
Dialogue: standing, lips pursed.

Speaker: debbie salt
Dialogue: Hello, Gale, we've been waiting for you.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Okay, look, you guys - I applaud your methodical expertise but I have a question. What's going to happen after I die? I thought the heroine is supposed to live.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Not this time.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Yeah, we're trying to send a message to Hollywood. I'm really getting tired of all the happy endings. It's just not reality. In the real world the good guys die, the innocent are punished, and the murderers inherit the earth.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: But nobody wants to see that. It'll never go. They'll rewrite you. You don't want that.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Oh, Sid, you're sounding desparate. I guess fearing death makes one anxious.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: You fucking freaked out movie nut psychos...

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Don't blame the movies, Sid. Movies don't create pyschos.

Dialogue: Don't you know that by now? It's about family. It all starts at home. It starts with the father... and the mother.

Dialogue: Mrs. Loomis?

Dialogue: What?

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Oh my God.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Jesus. It can't be.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Everything's taken on a hyper- reality, hasn't it?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: You're Billy's mother?

Speaker: debbie salt
Dialogue: I couldn't believe you didn't recognize me. You even interviewed me for your book.

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: You're all in this together?

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: We had to have financing.

Speaker: hallie
Dialogue: Tuition's expensive.

Speaker: sidney
Dialogue: Why Mrs. Loomis?

Speaker: debbie salt
Dialogue: Where should we start? Your mother ruined my marriage by sleeping with my husband. You ruined my family by killing my son. Gale aired it to the world. Should I go on... isn't that enough?

Speaker: gale
Dialogue: Jesus, you're just as whacked as your son.

Dialogue: Where do you think he got it? Mental illness is heriditary. Who do you think incouraged him to kill your mother? He was a smart kid but children need parental guidance.

Speaker: derek
Dialogue: Yeah, she's been great, Sid. We never would have been able to it without her.

Speaker: debbie salt
Dialogue: And I couldn't have done it without you two. Now who won the coin toss?

Dialogue: I did.

Speaker: derek

Dialogue: Nice kids but a little out there.

Dialogue: What are you going to do?

Dialogue: Finish what my son started.

Dialogue: Who would you like to shoot first, Cotton?
